abstracts.cdata!:
The project's global objective is
            to promote the conservation and sustainable use of
            biodiversity in Mexico through the consolidation of the
            National System of Protected Areas (SINAP). Project
            development objectives are: 1) to conserve globally
            important biodiversity in selected areas of SINAP; 2) to
            promote the economic, social and environmental
            sustainability of productive activities in selected
            protected areas; 3) to promote social co-responsibility for
            conservation; 4) and to promote the inclusion of
            biodiversity conservation and sustainable use criteria in
            development projects. It is intended to carry out actions
            related to education, agricultural diversification of
            production and manufacturing, artistic and sporting
            activities aimed at school-age population, women, seniors
            and groups of producers organized in conditions of
            vulnerability or belonging to indigenous groups. The
            approach of the project towards indigenous groups fully
            respects the Mexican legal framework protecting their
            rights. An indigenous peoples strategy has been prepared to
            ensure that indigenous communities participate and benefit
            from the project. The project is not expected to have any
            negative impact on indigenous population. The present plan
            is intended to address the agricultural socio-cultural
            reality in all its diversity to ensure that indigenous and
            vulnerable groups become feasible actors and subjects in the
            medium term transformation and who will improve their living
            conditions, under a framework of sustainability. The project
            will contribute to improving the living conditions of
            indigenous people who experience very high poverty in the
            Reserve, in terms of economic, social, health, environmental
            and cultural areas.
